title: (x) New Work thin stressed geometric sans - Fashion Thin {Mike F}
content:
First post here, just found the forum.

I stumbled upon this type in issue one of New Work magazine, and can’t for the life of me figure out what it is. I’m looking for it or something like it, commercial or otherwise.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [newwork.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415214025/http:/typophile.com/files/newwork.jpg) | 40.96 KB |

 [‹ (x) "Add it up" swashy type in Urban Outfitters catalogue - Zanzibar {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415214025/http:/typophile.com/node/44175 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Restoring Endangered Trees, similar to ITC Golden - Adobe Jenson {James Block} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415214025/http:/typophile.com/node/44150 "Go to next forum topic")
author: casualfont

comments.content: If this is the magazine’s logo, it might have been a custom-drawn job.

It’s not their logo, but a typo piece filling a page, as seen on [http://www.newworkmag.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415214025/http:/www.newworkmag.com/ "http://www.newworkmag.com/")

They say that all of their typefaces are customized, so I’m really more looking for the base font.
It looks like another appearance of [Fashion Thin](http://web.archive.org/web/20080415214025/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20952).
